translation: It's appropriate for us to bow at their feet and say, I'll go to the other side and return to Jambudvīpa.'

translation: The merchant lord then addressed the people, saying, 'I'll accept that statement in the iron city, but it's not like this!'

source_sentence: 乃至馬王未語已來無宜逼近，要待馬王飽食香稻身體充悅，舉首四顧三說是言：「誰向彼岸歸贍部洲？」
translation: Even if the king of horses hadn't said anything, it wouldn't be advisable to crowd them. translation: When he hears these words, he goes to the horse's place and seeks to cross the ocean.'

source_sentence: 時馬食訖四顧三告，諸人聞已就禮其足，合掌恭敬作如是語：『我等求向彼岸還贍部洲。』
translation: When the horse had finished eating, he looked around three times and said, 'The people who heard him bowed at his feet, joined their palms in respect, and said, 'We're seeking to go back to the other shore and return to Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 時彼馬王告諸人曰：『汝等若欲安渡大海歸贍部洲者，當依我教諦受思惟，若不依者無由越渡。
translation: The king of horses then told the people, 'If you want to cross the great ocean and return to Jambudvīpa, you must rely on my teaching and contemplate it carefully; if you don't, there's no way to cross.

source_sentence: 彼羅剎女化作美容倍勝常日，將諸男女來相誘誑作如是語：「我依汝活為作歸依，今棄我去欲何所適？
translation: The Rāṣṭrapāla woman transformed herself into a beauty that was twice as beautiful as usual, and she lured the men and women together with such words, saying, I relied on you for my livelihood and took refuge in you, so why would I abandon me now?

source_sentence: 如上所陳，宅舍、珍寶咸皆具說，若不住者汝之男女自可持將。」
translation: As shown above, the houses and treasures are all explained, and if they don't abide, your men and women can themselves maintain them.

source_sentence: 汝等若聞如是告時，生顧戀心作妻子想，愛彼珍寶及諸園觀，情生願樂欲到還者，縱昇我背必當墮落，猶如熟果不住其枝。
translation: If you listen to such an announcement, give rise to thoughts of affection for your wife and children, love treasures and parks, and wish to go back and forth, even if they ascend my back, they'll surely fall down like ripened fruit that doesn't abide in its branches.

source_sentence: 時彼諸女復羅剎像，皆競取食皮肉筋骨，腸胃血髓髮毛爪齒，皆盡無餘，廣說如前，乃至渧血在地悉皆取食。
translation: The women then again resembled the rāṣṭrapāla, all competing to eat skin, flesh, tendons, and bones, intestines, stomach, blood, marrow, hair, nails, and teeth, all of which were exhausted without remainder, as explained in detail above, up to the point where they all ate crudely burned blood on the ground.

source_sentence: 若其汝等遵奉我教，不起如是愛戀心者，持我一毛亦不墮落，能超大海至贍部洲。』
translation: If you follow my teaching and don't give rise to such a mind of love and attachment, holding one hair of mine doesn't fall off, and it can go from the great ocean to Jambudvīpa.'

source_sentence: 時彼馬王於諸商人善教語已，即便低身令彼附近，或持騣尾及以身毛隨情執捉。
translation: After he had taught the merchants well, that king of horses even lowered their bodies and caused them to come near him, or they might take a wild tail or hair on their bodies and grasp it according to their feelings.

source_sentence: 時彼天馬踊身虛空，望贍部洲騰驤雲路。
translation: The gods and horses then flew up into the sky with their bodies, looking out over Jambudvīpa and rising up a path of clouds.

source_sentence: 「爾時恐畏幡動，羅剎見怪作如是念：『今此幡動，豈非贍部洲人棄我逃逝？』
translation: Fearful of the banners moving, the Rāṣṭrapāla saw this wonder and thought, 'Now that these banners are moving, isn't it because the people of Jambudvīpa abandoned me and fled?'

source_sentence: 遍觀房舍不見有人，即皆變形作美女像，持諸男女咸至大海求覓商人。
translation: When he looked around the dwelling and saw no one there, they all changed their forms into beautiful women and men and went to the ocean to search for merchants.

source_sentence: 既遙見已隨後啼泣，告言：『賢首！
translation: Seeing them from a distance, he cried and said, 'Good man!

source_sentence: 何意踈我并諸男女棄捨而去？
translation: What's the point of pitying me and the men and women who abandoned them and departed?

source_sentence: 君等若並厭背我者，汝之稚子各並携將。』
translation: If you're all disgusted with turning your backs on me, each of your young children will carry the general.'

source_sentence: 時諸商人聞是語已，各生顧戀於彼宅舍，及以園池并諸珍寶起愛念時，於天馬上身皆墮落，猶如熟果不住其枝。
translation: When the merchants heard these words, they each became attached to their homes, gardens, ponds, and treasures, and lost their bodies on a heavenly horse, just like ripened fruit that didn't abide in its branches.

source_sentence: 時羅剎女隨取食之如馬王所說。
translation: The Rāṣṭrapāla woman then followed him and ate it, just as the horse king said.

source_sentence: 唯商主一人心無顧戀，憑附天馬得出海岸，安隱無礙達贍部洲。」
translation: Only one of the merchant lords had no attachment in his mind, so he relied on a heavenly horse to get off the shore and reached Jambudvīpa in peace and without obstruction.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告諸苾芻曰：「汝等觀此諸人，由生愛戀不順教故悉皆墜墮。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the monks, observing these people, They all fell down because they became attached to them and disobeyed the teaching.

source_sentence: 當知汝等若於自身作如是念：『眼即是我，我有於眼，乃至耳鼻舌身意亦復如是。
translation: You should know that if you think of yourself in this way, 'The eye is self, and I have the eye, so it is with my ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

source_sentence: 又念色即是我，我有於色，乃至聲香味觸法。
translation: Also, mindfulness of form is self, and I have form, even sound, odor, taste, touch, and dharmas.

source_sentence: 又念地界是我，我有於地，乃至水界、火界、風界、空界、識界。
translation: Also, he's mindful that the earth element is self, and I have earth, up to the water element, fire element, wind element, air element, space element, and consciousness element.

source_sentence: 又念色蘊是我，我有色蘊，受想行識亦復如是。』
translation: Also, mindfulness of the form aggregate is self, and I have the form aggregate, and so are feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若起如是我我所想，於自於他情生耽著，棄背正教欣樂邪道，便當墮落生死海中，受諸苦惱無有出期。
translation: If someone gives rise to such a conception of self and what belongs to self, becomes attached to self and other feelings, abandons right teaching and delights in wrong paths, they'll fall into the ocean of birth-and-death, experience suffering and distress with no hope of escape.

source_sentence: 譬如無智商人棄天馬教，愛羅剎女墮大海中。
translation: It's like a wise merchant who abandons the teaching of heavenly horses and loves Rāṣṭrapāla and falls into the ocean.

source_sentence: 汝諸苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若於自身不作是念：『眼即是我，我有於眼，乃至耳鼻舌身意。
translation: If someone doesn't think about themselves, 'The eye is self, and I have the eye, even my ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

source_sentence: 色即是我，我有於色，乃至聲香味觸法。
translation: Form is the self, and I have form, even sound, odor, taste, touch, and dharmas.

source_sentence: 地界是我，我有於地，乃至水界、火界、風界、空界、識界。
translation: The earth realm is self, and I am in the earth realm, up to the water realm, fire realm, air realm, space realm, and consciousness realm.

source_sentence: 色蘊是我，我有色蘊，受想行識亦復如是。』
translation: The aggregate of form is self, and I have the aggregate of form, and so are feeling, perception, volition, and consciousness.'

source_sentence: 汝等苾芻！
translation: You monks!

source_sentence: 若能不作如是我我所想，於自於他情無耽著，受行正教棄背邪道，即不墮落生死海中，安隱快樂趣涅槃城。
translation: If they can refrain from such thoughts of self and what belongs to self, don't cling to self or other feelings, receive and practice the right teaching and abandon wrong paths, then they won't fall into the ocean of birth-and-death and are comfortable and blissful in the city of nirvāṇa.

source_sentence: 譬如有智商主受天馬教，棄羅剎女能出大海至贍部洲。」
translation: It's like a wise merchant lord who receives the teaching of heavenly horses and abandons the Rāṣṭrapāla woman so that he can leave the ocean and reach Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 「諸有無智人，　　不信於佛教，
translation: “Those who have no wisdom don’t believe in Buddhism.

source_sentence: 當受輪迴苦，　　如愛羅剎女。
translation: They'll experience the suffering of transmigration like a woman who loves Rāṣṭrapāla.

source_sentence: 若有智慧人，　　遵奉於佛教，
translation: If there are wise people who follow Buddhism,

translation: They'll be born in the sea of death, just like following the words of a heavenly horse.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說伽他曰：爾時世尊告諸苾芻：「彼諸商人不能奉持天馬教故，於大海中悉皆墮落，被羅剎女之所噉食。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke these verses: The Bhagavān then addressed the monks, Because those merchants couldn't follow the teaching of heavenly horses, they all fell into the ocean and were eaten by the Rāṣṭrapāla women.

source_sentence: 唯商主師子胤，受天馬教堅心專一，安隱能得出於大海至贍部洲。
translation: Only the merchant lord Shizi Yin, who had been instructed by the gods and horses to firmly concentrate his mind with one-pointed concentration, could safely leave the great sea and reach Jambudvīpa.

source_sentence: 時師子胤妻大羅剎女，不尋其夫住在城內，諸羅剎女俱來告曰：『如我等輩尋覓逃夫，持以歸還俱共噉食。
translation: When the lion's wife, the great Rāṣṭrapāla woman, didn't find her husband living inside the city, the Rāṣṭrapāla women all came and told him, 'Suppose we of us were to search for a running man and take him back with us to eat together.

source_sentence: 汝夫主去竟不遠求，准此情狀遣還贍部。
translation: Your husband's departure is not far from your request, so he sends it back to Jambudvīpa according to this sentiment.

source_sentence: 若即尋覓獲得者善，若不得者我當食汝不應致恨。』
translation: If you immediately search for it and obtain it, it's good; if you don't get it, I'll eat it; you shouldn't cause harm.'

source_sentence: 彼既聞已極生憂怖，告諸羅剎女曰：『汝等固執苦令覓者，我今宜往贍部洲內擒捉將來。』
translation: After hearing this, he became greatly distressed and told the Rāṣṭrapāla women, 'You're holding on to suffering and making them look for it, so now it's advisable for me to go into Jambudvīpa and capture them in the future.'

source_sentence: 眾羅剎女曰：『斯為甚善。』
translation: The rāṣṭrapāla women said, 'This is very good.'

source_sentence: 時商主婦即自騰虛超越大海，屈伸臂頃至贍部洲，化作可畏藥叉之像，猛害倍常在師子胤前當路而住。
translation: The merchant housewife then rose up into the air and flew beyond the ocean, flexed her arms in an instant to reach Jambudvīpa, transformed herself into a fearsome yakṣa image, and stayed on the road in front of Shizi Yin.

source_sentence: 時師子胤覩藥叉像，即拔利劍欲斬藥叉，彼便驚走避道而住。
translation: When Shizi Yin saw the image of the yakṣa, he drew his sharp sword and wanted to cut off the yakṣa, so he ran away in fear and stayed on the path.

source_sentence: 如是展轉不相捨離，遂於中路逢遇商旅。
translation: Thus, they didn't abandon each other in turn, so they met on the roadway and encountered a merchant.

source_sentence: 彼之商主與師子胤是舊知識，情懷莫逆歡讌言離。
translation: The merchant lord and Shizi Yin, who were old friends, had no feelings of hatred and rejoiced and said they were leaving.

source_sentence: 時彼羅剎化為美女，并携稚子具妙莊嚴，便詣中國商主之前，禮彼足已作如是白：『我是赤銅洲國王之女，父母娉我與師子胤商主為妻，携我母子歸贍部洲，於大海內遇摩竭魚觸破船舶，所有珍寶散失無遺，以我為不祥遂便見棄。
translation: The Rāṣṭrapāla then transformed into a beautiful woman and carried her youngest child with all the marvelous adornments, went to the Chinese merchant lord's presence, bowed his head at his feet, and said, 'I am the daughter of the king of the red copper continent. My parents married me as wife to the merchant lord Shizi Yin, took my mother and children back to Jambudvīpa

source_sentence: 我之幸會今得相逢，唯願將母子就彼申謝。』
translation: It's fortunate for me to be able to meet you now, so may I take my mother and son and express my thanks to them.'

source_sentence: 彼即告言：『我當送去。』
translation: He then told them, 'I will send you away.'

source_sentence: 時彼商主見此婦人慇懃懇惻，為往師子胤處告言：『知識！
translation: Seeing this woman's lust and anger, the merchant owner went to Shizi Yin and told her, 'Teacher!

source_sentence: 汝之妻室儀容可愛，復是王女。
translation: Your wife's manner and appearance are lovely, and she's also the king's daughter.

source_sentence: 如此儔匹舉世難求，既無大愆，不應輒棄，宜應收採與彼同居。』
translation: Thus, it's difficult to find such a horse in the world because there's no great horse, so you shouldn't abandon it; it's better to gather it and share it with them.'

source_sentence: 時師子胤告曰：『彼非王女，是赤銅洲暴惡羅剎眾中之大食人血肉，非我妻也。』
translation: Shizi Yin then told him, 'That's not a king's daughter; she's the great food eater of humans and flesh among the violent Rāṣṭrapāla people on the red copper continent who aren't my wife.'

source_sentence: 商主答曰：『若如是者何緣至此？』
translation: The merchant owner answered, 'If that's the case, why did you come here?'

source_sentence: 時師子胤具告因緣，商主聞已，默然無語，即以路糧并諸雜物贈已而去。
translation: Shizi Yin then told the story in detail, and when the merchant lord heard it, he remained silent and didn't say anything, so he gave him provisions for the road and other miscellaneous things to offer and departed.

source_sentence: 「時師子胤漸漸歸還至于本舍，時羅剎女亦隨其後，并携小童至師子胤宅，從倚門側在一邊住。
translation: When Shizi gradually returned to his original dwelling, the rāṣṭrapāla woman followed her, accompanied by a small boy, and went to Shizi's house, standing on one side of the door beside him.

source_sentence: 時彼眾人見其兒子共相告曰：『仁等當知！
translation: When those people saw their son, they all said to each other, 'You should know!'

source_sentence: 今此童兒觀其貌狀，是師子胤兒子不虛。』
translation: Now, this boy observes his appearance, which is the son of Shizi Yin and not false.'

source_sentence: 羅剎報曰：『君等鑒貌知是非虛，宿緣薄福被父所棄。』
translation: Rāṣṭrapāla replied, 'You men of discernment know what's false and what's true, and your past karmic conditions are so weak that you've been abandoned by your father.'

source_sentence: 告言：『姊妹從何處來？
translation: He said, 'Where did you come from, sister?'

source_sentence: 汝是誰婦？』
translation: Whose wife are you?'

source_sentence: 羅剎告曰：『我是赤銅洲國王之女，父母娉我與師子胤商主為妻，携我母子歸贍部洲，於大海內遇摩竭魚觸破船舶，所有珍寶散失無遺，以我為不祥遂便見棄，流離辛苦得達於此。
translation: The rāṣāṇa told him, 'I am the daughter of the king of the red copper continent. When they encountered a Maghā fish in the ocean and broke up the ship, all the treasures and treasures that they possessed were scattered and lost without exception

source_sentence: 幸願諸君將我及子就商主處而申懺謝。』
translation: May you all take me and my children to the merchant's place and express your repentance.'

source_sentence: 時彼諸人詣商主父母處，以事陳告。
translation: Those people then went to their parents, the merchant's parents, and told them about it.

source_sentence: 于時父母語師子胤曰：『彼是王女，宗族尊高隨汝遠來，深可悲歎，并携稚子益用傷懷。
translation: Their parents then said to Siṃhala, “This is the king’s daughter. Her clan is noble and following you from a great distance. We deeply regret this sorrowful fate as well as carrying your youngest child in our arms.

source_sentence: 汝可愍之無宜見棄，違心之事仁者不為。』
translation: It's not advisable for you to criticize him or abandon him, and it's not advisable for a man who doesn't do anything contrary to his mind.'

source_sentence: 時師子胤稽首三拜白父母曰：『彼非王女是惡羅剎，於赤銅洲縱大暴虐，漂泊商旅皆取食之。
translation: Siṃhala then bowed his head three times and said to her parents, 'That non- princess is a bad Rāṣṭrapāla who indulges in great violence on the red copper island and takes food from all the merchants and travelers floating there.

source_sentence: 我輩諸人並皆食盡，我有餘福得奉尊顏。』
translation: All of us people have all eaten up, and I have the remaining merit to offer my venerable appearance.'

source_sentence: 父母告曰：『一切女人皆是羅剎，何故爾婦獨與惡名，宜應收納召入居室。』
translation: His parents told him, 'All women are Rāṣṭrapāla, so why is that woman alone given a bad name? It's better to call her into the living quarters.'

source_sentence: 重白父母曰：『我知非人不堪共住，尊必愛念隨意納之，我向他家別求居止。』
translation: He repeatedly told his parents, 'I know that non-people can't live together; the honored one must love and take it as he wishes, so I'll go to another house to ask for a separate dwelling place.'

source_sentence: 親曰：『我為汝故喚入家庭，汝苦見嫌於我何用？
translation: Your relatives said, 'For your sake, I summoned you into my family, but what good is it for you to see me as suffering and dislike me?'

source_sentence: 宜隨汝意令彼母子逐緣自活。』
translation: It's advisable to follow your wishes and cause those mothers and children to live on their own according to their conditions.'

source_sentence: 即遣使者驅之使去。
translation: He then sent an envoy to drive the messenger away.

source_sentence: 「時彼母子既被擯斥便詣王門，諸臣總集嗟其美麗，即便俱入白大王言：『門有女人儀容罕匹，忽然至此靡識所由。』
translation: When that mother and child were reprimanded, they went to the king's entrance, and the ministers gathered together to admire their beauty, and they all went in and said to the great king, 'There's a woman at the entrance with an incomparable appearance who suddenly arrives here without knowing where she came from.'

source_sentence: 王言：『引入，我自親問。』
translation: The king said,'Introduce me, and I'll ask myself questions.'

source_sentence: 臣即召進，王見女人姿容絕代美貌無雙，便起染心極生愛著，告言：『善來美女！
translation: When the ministers summoned him, the king saw that the woman's appearance was unparalleled and her beauty was unsurpassed, so he became defiled and became extremely attached, and he told her, 'Well come, beautiful woman!'

source_sentence: 從何所來？
translation: Where did it come from?

source_sentence: 因何至此？』
translation: Why did you come here?'

source_sentence: 女便稽首白大王言：『我本住在大海南岸赤銅洲所，是國王女。
translation: The woman then bowed her head and said to the great king, 'I was originally staying at the red copper island on the shore of Mahāprajñāpāramitā, which is the king's daughter.
